block.p: Spanish cuisine is the focus of the Mediterranean Culinary Festival, which is sponsored by the James Beard Foundation and the International Olive Oil Council. It will take place tomorrow and Friday in the Winter Garden of the World Financial Center. Food and wine tastings, cooking demonstrations and cookbook signings are among the activities from 11:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. each day. Admission is free; tastings are $1 to $5.

Special dinners to celebrate the full moon will be served tomorrow and on June 16, July 16 and August 15 on the terrace at Estiatorio Milos, 125 West 55th Street. The cost is $55, plus drinks, tax and tip; reservations: (212) 245-7400.

Saturday and Sunday, the vast Whole Foods Market that opened yesterday at 905 River Road in Edgewater, N.J., will give free tastings, including smoked fish, cheeses, prepared foods, barbecue and baked goods. In the English Tea Salon on Sunday from 2 to 5 p.m., Miriam Novalle, of the T-Salon in Manhattan, will serve samples. Information: (201) 941-4000.

Saturday and Sunday from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m., Palmer Vineyards, 108 Sound Avenue in Aquebogue, N.Y., will sell six of its wines at half price. In addition, its 1995 barrel-fermented chardonnay will be reduced to $5, from $13.50: (631) 722-9163.

Families With Children From Vietnam is holding a benefit on Sunday from 2 to 6 p.m., with a demonstration of Vietnamese cooking followed by a multicourse dinner at Peter Kump's New York Cooking School, 50 West 23rd Street. Tickets, $100: (212) 674-5314.
